title.value: Erratum to: Rapid simultaneous acquisition of macromolecular tissue volume, susceptibility, and relaxometry maps (Magn Reson Med. 2022;87:781-­790.)
title.justification: The paper is an erratum to a previously published paper with a focus on the simultaneous acquisition of various maps related to macromolecular tissue volume and other parameters.
title.quote: Erratum to: Rapid simultaneous acquisition of macromolecular tissue volume, susceptibility, and relaxometry maps (Magn Reson Med. 2022;87:781-­790.)

extractions.description: This document is an erratum for a research article published in Magnetic Resonance in Medicine. The erratum addresses a correction in the number of subjects that should have been mentioned in the original abstract and Methods section of the research paper focusing on acquisitions related to macromolecular tissue volume, susceptibility, and relaxometry maps.

type.justification: The paper involves imaging of subjects and the acquisition and analysis of data from a 3T scanner, which are characteristics of empirical research.
type.quote: Methods Four adults were imaged on a 3T scanner using a multi-echo 3D GRE sequence acquired at three head orientations.

name.justification: The research is focused on imaging techniques involving a 3T scanner and related data acquisition methods, which falls under the field of MRI.
name.quote: Four adults were imaged on a 3T scanner using a multi-echo 3D GRE sequence acquired at three head orientations.

name.justification: The research involves imaging of biological tissue to acquire different parameter maps which is relevant to medicinal imaging.
name.quote: Rapid simultaneous acquisition of macromolecular tissue volume, susceptibility, and relaxometry maps
